description: Additive encounters tied to real POIs from locations.json. These trigger on first visit, repeat visits, or special conditions.

encounters.dialog: Captain Rex squints at you from the shadow of the concrete wall. "Another stray. Hope you bite raiders and not my people."
Your Pip-Boy crackles. A burst of static forms a pattern — almost like coordinates.
Your Geiger counter screams to life. For a moment, you swear the clicks form words.
The air hums. The ground vibrates. Something beneath the soil is awake.
A radstorm rolls across the horizon, shifting unnaturally as if avoiding you.
The storm whispers. Not wind. Not static. Something else.
A deep, resonant roar echoes from the cavern. Something massive is moving inside.
Fresh claw marks line the rock. Whatever lives here is hunting.
A shadow crosses the ridge — too large, too fast. You are not alone.
The rocks shift. Something is stalking you from above.
The sand crunches like glass beneath your boots. A faint green glow pulses in the crater.
Your Pip-Boy picks up a faint signal — rhythmic, deliberate, almost like Morse code.
A long-dead alarm system flickers to life as you enter. Something in the lab recognizes you.
A terminal hums softly. The screen flashes: "CORE TEMPERATURE: RISING".
The wind carries a metallic taste. A distant echo bounces through the empty buildings.
A figure stands in a window for a moment — then vanishes when you blink.
Your Pip-Boy flashes a radiation warning so intense it nearly overloads the screen.
A deep rumble shakes the ground. Something beneath the reactor is still alive.
A distorted broadcast cuts through your radio: "HELLO, WASTELANDERS!"
The static forms a voice — faint, broken, familiar. Jax?
A scrap of paper sits on the bar: "DON'T TOUCH THE HUMMING CRATE — SPARKPLUG".
Smoke rises from behind the building. Something was burned recently.
A merchant whispers: "Someone’s buying up pre-war tech. Paying in caps and silence."
